title: SpaceX launches Starship for the sixth time – with Trump on site to watch
content:
SpaceX conducted the sixth flight test of its massive Starship rocket on Tuesday afternoon, and although the company did not replicate the history-making booster catch, the company did welcome a very special guest: President-elect Donald Trump.  Trump, who will soon be sworn into office for his second term, said on X that he was headed […]

title: PSA: You shouldn’t upload your medical images to AI chatbots
content:
Security and privacy advocates have long warned that sensitive medical data can be used to train AI models, and can expose personal data down the line.

title: Kim Kardashian has befriended Optimus, the Tesla bot
content:
Pete Davidson? Kanye West? Step aside. Kim Kardashian’s new beaux is a Tesla bot named Optimus. The fashion mogul got some hands-on experience with Tesla’s bipedal, humanoid robot, which is not yet available to the general public. In Kardashian’s videos with the robot — posted to X and her Instagram story — she prompts Optimus […]

title: VW taps former Rivian exec to run US business
content:
Volkswagen of America has a new CEO: Rivian’s recently departed chief commercial officer Kjell Gruner. The appointment comes just one week after VW parent company Volkswagen Group formalized a $5.8 billion joint venture with Rivian, which will be focused on EV architecture and software. While Gruner’s new post isn’t really related to that new JV, […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

title: Chroma, backed by Pinterest and Twitter co-founders, sells to AI audio company Bronze
content:
Chroma, a startup building a new type of audiovisual entertainment for mobile devices, has been sold. The company, which had financial backing from Twitter and Medium co-founder Biz Stone as well as Pinterest co-founder Evan Sharp, is headed to London-based audio technology company Bronze, an AI music startup. Founded by record producer Lex Dromgoole, who’s […]

© 2024 TechCrunch. All rights reserved. For personal use only.

title: Meta hires Salesforce’s CEO of AI, Clara Shih, to lead new business AI group
content:
Meta hired Salesforce’s CEO of AI, Clara Shih, to lead a new organization building AI tools for businesses that use Meta’s apps to reach consumers, according to a LinkedIn post from Shih on Tuesday. Meta confirmed the appointment and the new Business AI group in a statement to TechCrunch. “I’m thrilled to share today that […]

title: OpenAI brings ChatGPT’s Advanced Voice Mode to the web
content:
OpenAI is expanding ChatGPT’s Advanced Voice Mode feature to the web, letting users talk to the AI chatbot right from their browser. The company’s chief product officer, Kevin Weil, announced the launch on X. The feature, which makes ChatGPT more natural to speak with, is rolling out to ChatGPT’s paying customers this week, which means […]

title: Google ships first developer preview Android 16 to speed up feature roll outs
content:
Google is releasing the first developer preview of Android 16 to speed up feature rollouts in devices. This is a major change in the Android rollout schedule as, over the past few years, Google released its first Android developer beta around Q2, with a stable release coming out post-July. With the new schedule, Android 16’s […]

title: Thanks, Netflix, but we don’t need another daily word game
content:

title: GitHub launches $1.25M open source fund with a focus on security
content:
The open source funding problem is very real, but a slew of initiatives have emerged of late, with startups, corporations, and venture capitalists launching various programs to support some of the most critical projects via equity-free financing. Today it’s GitHub’s turn, launching the GitHub Secure Open Source Fund with an initial commitment of $1.25 million […]

title: Google’s Gemini chatbot now has memory
content:
Google’s Gemini chatbot can now remember things like info about your life, work, and personal preferences. As flagged by posters on X (and Google’s official account), a “memory” feature has begun rolling out to certain Gemini users, including this reporter. Like ChatGPT’s memory, Gemini’s adds context to the current conversation. For example, tell Gemini to […]

title: Mitsubishi backs Ample’s radical approach to charging EV batteries
content:
Startup Ample is on a mission to convert commercial fleets into believers in the power of electric vehicle battery swapping technology.   The company has spent the last three years piloting its electric vehicle battery swapping technology in San Francisco, Madrid, and Japan. Now, Ample is preparing to turn some of those pilot customers into commercial […]

title: Codecrafters wants to challenge seasoned developers with hard-to-build projects

title: IRL social app Pie is coming to SF to make you less lonely
content:
After a robust career building Bonobos and advocating for founder mental health, Andy Dunn moved to Chicago with his family. A few years later, he came to a depressing realization: He hadn’t made any new friends. “I don’t think it’s easy to admit to yourself that you don’t have friends,” Dunn told TechCrunch, laughing. “It’s […]

title: YC-backed Formal brings a clever security reverse-proxy out of stealth
content:
Formal is a security startup coming out of stealth on Tuesday with a nice list of investors and an interesting product positioning.
